abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement plan and policy
            framework looks at the target areas, that includes the
            surrounding communal groups, within the Support to Economic
            Expansion and Diversification (SEED) Project area, to ensure
            full compliance in implementing the resettlement process. In
            particular, it focuses on the Imusho people, specifies their
            compensation, and ownership of new land, and addresses the
            need to diversify productive and business capacities, so
            that living standards are improved, safeguarded, or at least
            restored to former levels. Compensation for construction
            costs and materials, lost structures, crops and fruit
            trees' losses will be provided at replacement cost
            without depreciation. Specific compensation standards will
            be adjusted according to the current price index of the
            respective costs. Resettlement sites will be generally
            larger plots, with basic services provided, while
            resettlement of village people shall take into consideration
            cultural, and communal ties in order to facilitate social
            adjustment, and, will include transportation and moving
            expenses. The resettlement process will be closely
            monitored, with special grievance mechanisms in place,
            should conflict occur.
